page.title: 08Whitley Playgroup
page.content: The playgroup was started by Mrs Edna Dewar in l969 when it was privately owned. It is held in the Village Hall on two mornings from 9.30 to 12.00.The children start at 3 and leave at 5 years old when they start school. Five years ago it became community run and there is a committee to raise funds. There are two supervisors and two mums who help them to play, make things or paint till l0.30. During Register and milk their names are thrown on the floor and they learn to recognise them. Puzzles and games are also used. Every other week they have music.There is storytime and finger rhymes for all They have a coach trip every year and also visits to local farms, museums and places of interest. At present, there are l5 children, although they are allowed to have as many as 24.
